title: Barcelona prefer signing Marcus Rashford to Roberto Firmino transfer
text:
Rashford is on Barcelona’s radar (Picture: Getty)

Barcelona would prefer to sign Marcus Rashford over Roberto Firmino, according to reports.

The Catalan giants are in the midst of searching for a long-term replacement for Luis Suarez, who turns 33 in January.

Barcelona have been linked with a host of top strikers, including Premier League duo Firmino and Rashford.

Mundo Deportivo claim Barcelona have a long list of candidates for the job, but are unconvinced about Firmino’s suitablility.

Firmino is a big favourite at Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

The Brazilian has blossomed into a superstar at Liverpool, helping the Reds win the Champions League last season.

But Barcelona chiefs prefer Rashford to his Premier League rival, who they held talks with before he signed a new long-term deal at Manchester United last July.

Advertisement

Despite interest in Rashford, Paris Saint-Germain’s Kylian Mbappe and Tottenham’s Harry Kane lead Barcelona’s wishlist for a new No.9.

Luring either goalscorer away from their respective clubs, however, would be an expensive proposition.

Barcelona rate Kane and Mbappe as their two best options (Picture: Getty)

While Barcelona continue to weigh up their options, they will have been pleased with Suarez’s stunning return to form.

The Uruguayan has scored four goals in his last four appearances in all competitions, including a brace against Inter in the Champions League.

Barcelona are likely to hold off on signing a new No.9 should Suarez keep up his impressive form for the rest of the season.
